alert.note: Alert for Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:29AM EST until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... North Branch Rancocas Creek At Pemberton affecting Burlington County. For the Rancocas Creek...including Pemberton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Rancocas Creek at Pemberton. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 2.5 feet, Some minor flooding begins in Eastampton along Rustic, Peninsula, and Paducah Roads. Lee Street, Joe Road, and Jill Court in Southampton also begin to flood. At 3.5 feet, Lee Street, Joe Road, and Jill Court in Southampton are subject to evacuations. Old Georges Lane, Rancocas Trail in the Ewansville section of Southampton are also flooded as is Mae Avenue. The flooding in Eastampton spreads to West Railroad Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 2.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to a crest of 2.6 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 2.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 2.6 feet on 10/20/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date North Branch Ran Pemberton 2.5 2.4 Wed 11 a 2.6 2.5 2.6 1am 1/11 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
